message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.SP, cs.MM, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the problem of modulating a parameter onto a band-limited signal and estimating it at the receiver, which is a common problem in information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SP). The use of the mean power-$\alpha$ error (MP$\alpha$E) as a performance measure suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of statistical learning (cs.SI). The analysis of the achievable and converse bounds on the MP$\alpha$E exponent involves mathematical techniques such as optimization and probability theory, which are also relevant to the sub-categories of mathematical optimization (cs.MM) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
